definitions.definition: British term for preferred stock.
the goods or merchandise kept on the premises of a business or warehouse and available for sale or distribution.
examples: the store has a very low turnover of stock

definitions.definition: a supply or quantity of something accumulated or available for future use.
examples: I need to replenish my stock of wine

definitions.definition: farm animals such as cattle, pigs, and sheep, bred and kept for their meat or milk; livestock.
examples: animals, livestock, beasts; Moreflocks, herds "farm stock"Moreflocks, herds farm stock

definitions.definition: short for rolling stock.
photographic film that has not been exposed or processed.
examples: noun: film stock; plural noun: film stocks

definitions.definition: (in some card games) the cards that have not yet been dealt, left on the table to be drawn.
the capital raised by a business or corporation through the issue and subscription of shares.
examples: between 1982 and 1986, the value of the company's stock rose by 86%

definitions.definition: shares of stock of a particular company as held by an individual or group as an investment.
the shares of a particular company, type of company, or industry.
securities issued by the government in fixed units with a fixed rate of interest.
a person's reputation or popularity.
examples: I felt I was right, but my stock was low with this establishment
synonyms: prestige "her stock is low with most voters"

definitions.definition: liquid made by cooking bones, meat, fish, or vegetables slowly in water, used as a basis for the preparation of soup, gravy, or sauces.
the raw material from which a specified commodity can be manufactured.
examples: the fat can be used as soap stock

definitions.definition: a person's ancestry or line of descent.
examples: her mother was of French stock
synonyms: bloodline "his mother was of French stock"

definitions.definition: a breed, variety, or population of an animal or plant.
the trunk or woody stem of a living tree or shrub, especially one into which a graft (scion) is inserted.
the perennial part of a herbaceous plant, especially a rhizome.
a herbaceous European plant that is widely cultivated for its fragrant flowers, which are typically lilac, pink, or white.
an instrument of punishment consisting of an adjustable wooden structure with holes for securing a person's feet and hands, in which criminals were locked and exposed to public ridicule or assault.
the part of a rifle or other firearm to which the barrel and firing mechanism are attached, held against one's shoulder when firing the gun.
examples: handle, butt, haft, grip, shaft, shank the stock of a weapon

definitions.definition: the crosspiece of an anchor.
the handle of something such as a whip or fishing rod.
short for headstock (sense 1).
short for tailstock.
a band of white material tied like a cravat and worn as a part of formal horse-riding dress.
a piece of black material worn under a clerical collar.
a frame used to support a ship or boat out of water, especially when under construction.
have or keep a supply of (a particular product or type or product) available for sale.
examples: most supermarkets now stock a range of organic produce

definitions.definition: provide or fill with goods, items, or a supply of something.
examples: I must stock up the fridge
synonyms: load "the fridge was well stocked with milk"

definitions.definition: amass supplies of something, typically for a particular occasion or purpose.
fit (a rifle or other firearm) with a stock.
